cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 925 mi E of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, then bending northwest toward the northern Leeward Islands and the waters north of Puerto Rico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Leeward Islands (near or just north of Antigua–Barbuda area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, local waters north of Puerto Rico and Hispaniola
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands could bring brief tropical-storm-force gusts with an 11 % cumulative chance over the next 5 days; hurricane-force winds are not expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected given forecast track north of the island.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered heavy showers possible Sunday–Monday, but current guidance keeps totals mostly below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along north-facing beaches late weekend into early next week.
